sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Gosper curve.
message_1: What is the total length of the Gosper curve after 3 iterations, if the initial segment has a length of 1 unit?
message_2:
The Gosper curve, also known as the flowsnake or Peano-Gosper curve, is a fractal curve that is constructed by replacing each segment of the curve with a specific pattern of segments at each iteration. The length of the curve increases by a factor of (√7) with each iteration.

After 3 iterations, the length of the Gosper curve will be:

Initial length × (√7)^3
1 × (√7)^3
1 × (7√7)
7√7

So, the total length of the Gosper curve after 3 iterations is 7√7 units.
